column4: on my school machine I couldn't get the install disk to install properly from my optical either. I eventually ended up installing Debian sid and upgrading to Hoary preview in place :)
not that I suggest you do that, but that's what I ended up doing.

same deal with me. Booted from the CD, ended up using Smart Boot Manager as there was a (weak) BIOS password at the time with CD boot disabled. But then the installer would early on say "Looking for CDROM drivers.." or something, then fail.
*It* broke your Windows install?
; Yep
; I never got to install anything
you played no part in that?
: Not unless booting up the ubuntu CD and trying to detect the CDROM did it.
; Which it didn't.
slam in the XP CD and do a repair. It'll work.
: I dont care enough about it to do that.
; my powerbook is still working fine ;)
heh
that's what I said on Sept 8th, 2001. I still haven't gotten around to fixing that old Windows install.
did you install gstreamer0.8-mad from universe?
streamer is being held back it says
if it is held back it means you need to do a dist-upgrade.
that's how I got to hoary to begin with.
well you may need to run it again.
That's what I'm saying -- I just tried it again and it didn't do anything.
okay.
